page.title: 10ST. LAWRENCE CHURCH
page.content: Bovingdon Parish Church was first built in 1320. Then restored, probably because of being unsafe, in 1846. They kept the floor and tower. The tower is about 80 feet tall. On March the first next year the church will be 140 years old. One family the Ryder family, paid mostly for the restoration of the church. There are 6 windows and 7 stone tablets in memory of the Ryder family. They kept 2 bells. They had the first bell in 1654 and the second one year later. There were also 2 other bells which were put in recently. Now they are rung by electricity.
